Bill Clinton -- if (window && window.foxstrike && Array.isArray(window.foxstrike.cmd)) { window.foxstrike.cmd.push(function(Strike) { Strike.insertAd('desktop', 'lb18', 'desktop-desk-ad-lb18', ''); }); } else { console.error('Error: window.foxstrike not found'); }

utterances.sentences: Of course it matters. if (window && window.foxstrike && Array.isArray(window.foxstrike.cmd)) { window.foxstrike.cmd.push(function(Strike) { Strike.insertAd('desktop', 'lb19', 'desktop-desk-ad-lb19', ''); }); } else { console.error('Error: window.foxstrike not found'); }

utterances.sentences: "La La Land" is back at it. The celebrity madness hitting a whole new level with their latest attacks against President Trump. Here is a late-night talk show host, Seth Meyers.

utterances.speaker: SETH MEYERS, LATE NIGHT TALK SHOW HOST
utterances.sentences: Trump is totally incoherent and incapable of telling the truth. He shouldn't get to address the nation just to repeat his lies. If he calls up the networks asking for airtime, they should pick up the phone and say --

utterances.speaker: PRESIDENT DONALD TRUMP
utterances.sentences: President Trump, we don't know who that is.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Tough guy Robert De Niro continuing his attacks, now calling Trump a "white supremacist and a real racist who is bad for the country." And actor Samuel L. Jackson jumping on the bandwagon, tweeting his endorsement of Congresswoman Rashid Tlaib's use of extreme profanity to describe the president. Dana, do you notice a difference in the assaults on the president of the United States compared to George W. Bush and now Donald J. Trump?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: It was pretty bad.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Pretty bad back then?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: It was pretty bad. But they didn't call him a white supremacist. That was not it. But it really had to do with the war and there was a lot of anger and frustration after the recount. I mean, I'm not excusing any of it, but I think --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Because that was policy driven it seems like because the war really agitated a lot of people in Hollywood.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: But the thing for George W. Bush is they said he was stupid.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Right.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Right. Everyone thought they were smarter than he was.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Do they think that about President Trump too?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: I'm sure that they do. And this is interesting for like Hollywood, for me. I've never been enamored with it. utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Greg, do you just like the fact that you have favorite actors, like a Samuel L. Jackson or Robert De Niro, who you love their movies, but then when they talk politics, you are like oh, my gosh. What is he saying?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: It's disappointing because it tells you two things, that the most outspoken in Hollywood think alike because it's lockstep. They don't like half the country.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: And the first one for social media.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: But I got to tell you, you know who should send roses every day to Donald Trump? George Takei, aka Sulu, who now has a new T.V. show. And he1's actually kind of funny, but my point is. A lot of these people owe it to Trump because they were nowhere and now they are somewhere.

utterances.sentences: Juan, do you think these kind of, you know, these kind of slanderous statements against the president, outrageous, they get on Fox News. Do you think that makes the Democratic Party as a whole look bad?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: You know, just to average Americans, independents, people that are not totally tuned in.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: I don't approve of the profane language, if that's what you mean. And obviously, you know, you sit next to me everyday. You know I don't like the bullying. I don't like the personal attacks that the president engages in. I think imitating that behavior is not attractive to me. And I don't think it's attractive to most people. But I mean, obviously some people excuse it and say, big deal. Not to them. I will say this, I think the big issue here is not somehow that Hollywood elites, the people like or don't like. It's that people are saying this president lies constantly. Tonight, the worry is he's going to lie again, tell them more lies and then people get frustrated and angry and use profanity. But I mean, I would just come back to the actual issue. Let's stick to the facts. Let's not make up stories in order to justify actions of a tyrant. Let's not do that.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Well, I think the president will be fact-checked by his own staff and by the mainstream media.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Never happened to Obama.

utterances.sentences: Greg Gutfeld. Why are you laughing?

utterances.speaker: COMPAGNO
utterances.sentences: But that's like having the influence. To me, you know, the common theme of Hollywood and the Hollywood versus Trump is just the hypocrisy. And these are the guys saying that the guy in the Oval Office is the one perpetuating a polarized society or that he's the one that doesn't care about low income or minority communities. And one of the quotes that we read by Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez that says the GOP lost entitlement to policing women's behavior a long time ago. Oh, like in this regard, like Hollywood still has that honor? Like, oh, that's right, because women have been respected economically, sexually in the market all around by Hollywood this entire time. So every time a celebrity opens their mouth with just such a vitriol that isn't policy- based, I just think they are hypocrite (ph).

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: It's a good question if they are more influential now. I think that if they were influential, Hillary Clinton would be president.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: That's true.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: And obviously not (ph).

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: That Jay Z and Beyonce rally would've put her over the top.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Not that. Remember Katy Perry?

utterances.sentences: Ooh.

utterances.speaker: COMPAGNO
utterances.sentences: Totally. And Kevin Spacey's.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: I just think -- I --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Let's -- let's leave you with that though, America. Just two weeks after the murder of a California police officer by an undocumented immigrant the new governor now promising sanctuary for all illegals. Ahead.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Now, that's a classic, Jesse. The president is set to address the nation tonight on what he's calling a crisis at the southern border. Hmm. And we also have just learned that he has invited congressional leaders back to the White House for a meeting tomorrow afternoon. But while the president is hoping to secure a wall deal, liberals like new California Governor Gavin Newsom promising policies in stark contrast to the Trump administration. He is vowing to give "sanctuary" to all who seek it.

utterances.speaker: GOV. GAVIN NEWSOM, D-CALIF.
utterances.sentences: Together let us build a house stronger than the coming storms yet open to the world. A house that provides shelter to all who need it and sanctuary to all who seek it.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: He's also proposing a budget to extend health care coverage to undocumented immigrants up to the age of 26. Of course, Emily, that's extending health care coverage to everyone in the state. And he says basically, and we saw that today and, by the way, in New York. The governor reelected in New York saying the same thing. These are folks who are pushing this. But you're a Californian, and I just wanted to ask you, what do you think about Gavin Newsom and what do you think about his approach? Because I was stunned when I read this. Because I get to sit next to these guys every day. California had a huge budget surplus. They've got money sitting around.

utterances.speaker: COMPAGNO
utterances.sentences: Well, to your first question: what do I think about him? What do I think about his policies? And as a Californian, you know, my memory is fresh of him being a mayor in San Francisco. That's when he was called a philosopher king, where he was basically full of these ideas. And he always said that the best politics is a better idea. But frankly, it really didn't do a lot. And there were a lot of things that he says as the hallmark or the pinnacle of his term as mayor that really didn't have an effectuated result. For example, homelessness in San Francisco or some of the environmental projects that he didn't start and didn't finish but has taken some credit for. In terms of the Medi-Cal and him expanding coverage from 19 to 26, you know, just last year an audit uncovered that $4 billion of Medi-Cal has gone to ineligible recipients. So to me, it would behoove him as the next governor if he would clean up programs before trying to expand them. And I just think what we're getting from him is a lot of messaging and grandstanding without the actual implementation that we can count on.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Was that an alarm? Was that a national emergency?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: That was a national emergency at the border.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Either that or it was gas.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: That was -- oh. All right. So what do you think? I mean, I'm just struck by the idea that you get big liberal state governors like Newsom come forward, not only -- really going after Trump. And Trump has gone after California repeated times. Now Gavin Newsom comes back and says, "It's not going to be one house for the rich, one for the poor, one for native-born, one for immigrants. California is going to be one house for all."

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: It's a nice sales pitch. Attacking the president is always good if you're a Democrat. I think he is trying to cater to the Hispanic population in the state, assuming that the Hispanic population in the state likes sanctuary laws. Polling says they don't like sanctuary laws. California, the population of Hispanics is, I think, 40 percent of the state is Hispanic. Three million illegal aliens working right now in the state of California. And you know they have a great agriculture industry, service industry, construction industry. You know, he's catering to those people. But California is such a beautiful state. Silicon Valley and the coastlines and Hollywood. That they can afford to mismanage the entire state and still kind of technically get away with it. Because if you look at the homeless crisis there, drug abuse, crime in the major cities, the massive income inequality that I guess they don't mind there, there's a lot of imbalance in that state. But because it's such a -- it's probably the most perfect state in the country with such an enormous economy, when you compared to other countries in the world, they can buy with giving everybody free stuff.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: All right. So Dana, when you listen to Gavin Newsom, do you think he has a political future?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Yes, I was just thinking, it's actually pretty exciting to watch this next generation of liberal leaders run for office, get elected. And he's done -- he's kind of put in his time. Right? So he went from mayor. Then he was lieutenant governor, and now he's governor. I think he's pretty effective and pretty persuasive. I don't know if he's effective in terms of the actual programs and the follow-through. I am curious about how all these things are going to get paid for. Maybe because Jerry Brown left a big surplus, he's got room to play. I am pretty excited to just hear them and see how they're going to actually try to convince America that that's the direction to go.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: But is he likable, Dana?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: I think he's likable. I'm going to go with likable.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Yes, and good looking.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: OK.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Yes. Good looking and strong voice. Right? So --

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Strong voice, that's always a good one.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Stentorian, I think, Greg. But by the way, Greg, you were born in California.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: You're a native Californian.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: That is true.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Two Californians at the table.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: But when I read this, I thought 116 billion reserve, 14.8 billion in unrestricted surplus. I thought you told me California was --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: They're taxing --

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: -- cratering.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: They're taxing people to death. That's why people are leaving. It's a horror show. If you go to San Francisco, you better be an Olympian in hopscotch, because you're going to be jumping over feces-encrusted transient campgrounds.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: OK.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: So the point is this governor has misplaced priorities. He's choosing to virtue signal with sanctuary cities, because that has no ultimate consequence to himself. Meanwhile, you have a rise in disease, epidemic proportions in Southern California because of these campgrounds, of hepatitis and whatever, TB, whatever you're seeing there. I'm not exactly sure which diseases, but talk to Dr. Drew. He'll tell you.; So because he has presidential aspirations, he's figuring out the right things to say that will raise his stature so he becomes, like, the anti- Trump. I think that's why he's doing this. As for the -- paying for the health care, it really should upset you that you are paying for the health care of noncitizens.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: That is something that should piss the hell out of you.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Even if they live next door?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Oh, yes. In fact -- in fact, I am -- I mean, De Blasio is doing -- we pay more than our fair share in New York City. I know. And the fact that we are now extending this. So we're talking about you're not for a strong border if you are creating enticements to cross it, whether it is -- whether it is through sanctuary cities or paying for health care. That is basically saying, "Border, screw you. Come across, risk your lives. Risk your children's lives to come here and get the free stuff." It's disgusting. This is why -- it is just -- I'm not.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Is it similar to Britain?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes. I'm not excited by this. I just think it's sad.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: You're making -- you're making very good points, but do you think this is similar to what happened in the U.K. --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: -- where they said, "Here's all these --"

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Freebies.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: -- "the benefits." And then you -- you didn't have people that were fleeing oppression --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: -- stopping in any country. They would wait until they got to Britain, and that's where they wanted to stop.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: OK, so let me -- let me just change subjects briefly at the end of this segment. The president now inviting Democrats back to the White House tomorrow after the speech tonight. Jesse, what do you make of this?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: I think he knows it's crunch time, because right now, no one one has gone without a paycheck. If you think about it, we're hearing a lot of hysteria of the people not getting paid. That doesn't even happen until the 14th. He knows the 14th is the first time that federal workers then don't get paychecks. So I think within the next week, he wants to get a deal done.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: And Emily, he's already said he wants to get IRS workers back so they can issue refunds for taxes. But you know, we've been through two years where there apparently wasn't a crisis, with Republicans in power. Now he says there's a crisis. Now he wants the Democrats to come in. Is there an out that you can foresee where that Democrats could help them get out of this box?

utterances.speaker: COMPAGNO
utterances.sentences: By collaboration and coming to an agreement.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: How?

utterances.speaker: COMPAGNO
utterances.sentences: By -- well, in some --

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: What could they offer?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Tonight apparently, he is going to appeal to bipartisan agreement about border security, which everyone should be able to agree on, and national security. I think that this means, by him announcing today that he's calling them back tomorrow that he will not announce a national emergency tonight. That he'll maybe say that "I'm prepared to. I'm not -- let's have one more shot at this. Let's try to work together." Because if you go back to FOX News voter analysis from the midterms, one of the No. 1 things people who voted said they wanted was for more bipartisan cooperation to get things done. So I think maybe he'll try that tactic one more time with them before he does anything on a national emergency.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: The FNVA? Fox News Voter Analysis.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Yes, very good. But Emily, I just wanted to finish up with you. If he needs Democrats to get out of this box, is what I think you guys are saying.

utterances.speaker: COMPAGNO
utterances.sentences: Yes, and I think that's what you're highlighting, is what every citizen needs, which is our elected officials to come together in a collaborative way and to not just simply stay in their corner and fold their arms. Absolutely, we need our government elected officials to do their job together tomorrow. So I love that he's calling them back after tonight. Maybe his speech will hold their feet to the fire, given the public coverage of it, and then tomorrow we can see them get to work and accomplish something.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Greg.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Get the engineers in there. That's all I say.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: All right. It's the viral video everyone is talking about. Why one woman completely loses it at the airport. Yes, really. You've got to see this. That's next on "The Five."

utterances.speaker: COMPAGNO
utterances.sentences: We've all felt frustration while waiting at the airport, but one woman became completely unhinged, and her epic meltdown is now a viral sensation.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.sentences: (EXPLETIVE DELETED) Get me out of here! You rapists!

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: What?

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.sentences: Get me out of here! Get me out of here! I have a (EXPLETIVE DELETED) gun on me, because I'm hopeless. Get me out!

utterances.speaker: COMPAGNO
utterances.sentences: The woman was eventually subdued and detained. And a JetBlue spokesperson told FOX News she was denied boarding due to being intoxicated and disruptive. All right. So Greg, you have an interesting take on this.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Well, I'm -- I really don't like showing these videos on TV. I don't think we're helping anybody when we show these things. We're a country now where we're bored, and so we're being fed unfortunate experiences on smartphones of people who may have medical, psychiatric issues. Maybe she mixed prescription meds with alcohol. Maybe she has a deep-seated psychiatric problem. And yet, people's bad days become really entertaining for us, and we can pretend and say, "Oh, we feel really bad about this person or that person." But if we felt really bad, we wouldn't show it. That's my feeling.

utterances.speaker: COMPAGNO
utterances.sentences: Dana, was that a bad day or was that a gnarly meltdown?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Well, I don't know. I mean, it is possible that she had something else going on. I just -- I know that -- I've never actually -- I've never witnessed anything like this at an airport, but I always do feel sympathy for the airline workers. I feel like they take a lot of crap from a lot of people. Sometimes, you can get frustrated for legitimate reasons. But like, if your flight is delayed because of weather, then obviously, that's not a reason to scream at the staff. So I don't know what happened here. I hope she's better.

utterances.speaker: COMPAGNO
utterances.sentences: How about you?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: This would never happen with delta. Delta is the best carrier out there.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: That's where you got your free --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: The medallion in 2019 right there, I'm coming for you. I'm also impressed about how she hoisted herself up on the table area. That was impressive physically. I agree with Greg to the extent that we like watching meltdowns, because it makes us feel less crazy.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Right.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: You like saying "Oh, look at you," and then pointing the finger. The only thing better than a regular meltdown is a celebrity meltdown. Then you get the best of both worlds.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: That's true.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: I also just think we take it for granted that we're getting on these planes. We're not afraid to die. We're flying all over the country. We land; everything is great.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: It's only a couple hundred dollars. We should be grateful because of this country, you can just fly across the country and everything is fine.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: COMPAGNO
utterances.sentences: Have you ever seen anything crazy in an airport? You travel so much.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Yes. I've seen people get mad, but she called them a rapist. I was like, where did that come from? What is going on here? Now, I will say apparently -- this is Fort Lauderdale Airport -- there was a 20-hour delay involved.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Ooh.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Which that wasn't her plane. It was like she just -- yes, yes, yes.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Right. But then the airline said she was drunk and maybe on prescriptions. We had a situation at Dulles where Kevin Rooney, the soccer star, was taken in and arrested. But apparently, he was also taking some prescription drug. Maybe like taking something to sleep while he's on the plane --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Take an Ambien.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: -- to combine it with alcohol, you're in bad shape.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: That's not a good idea.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Oh, tell me about it.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: I find, you know, there are moments when I think Greg can be compassionate.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: [laughs]

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: You know what I mean? That you showed some human -- for this lady in a way I didn't anticipate.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Well, I just don't -- I don't think it's -- I feel like we're finding people at their very worst, and we don't have the compassion to just say, "You know what? We don't have to look at it." We will click on it.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: You're saying this, because this could be you. This is your spirit animal.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: This could be anybody. You never know.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: This is why you show up to the airport 20 days before your flight.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: That is true. You never know.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: This is an ego act for him. He's just protecting himself.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: So true.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: I was so foolish. I fell for it.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: He's not compassionate; he's selfish!

utterances.speaker: COMPAGNO
utterances.sentences: I think there's something about airports, though, that for some reason, there's like this heightened sense of --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Of course.

utterances.speaker: COMPAGNO
utterances.sentences: And maybe it is the, like, fear of death at any minute and the high federal security, and this microcosm of the world, because we're all in these small places. But there is something about an airport that lends itself to freak-outs and people being totally frightened by these freak- outs.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: A lot of people don't fly that often.

utterances.speaker: COMPAGNO
utterances.sentences: This came and he guy missed his flight, because apparently another flight attendant -- whatever, it was a miscommunication, he claimed. So he got to the gate, and he had missed -- they had closed the thing. And he took his bag, and he chucked it at the -- yes, over the counter and was screaming. And literally, it was like, I feel like in any other instance, maybe people would have intervened, but in this -- in that kind of situation, literally the entire gate --

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: It's nerve-racking.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: It's Lou Dobbs.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Because you think your flight is going to get canceled.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Is that who it is?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: It was Lou Dobbs. That's why nobody did anything.

utterances.speaker: COMPAGNO
utterances.sentences: OK.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Let's go to the video.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: I have it on tape.

utterances.speaker: COMPAGNO
utterances.sentences: "One More Thing" is up next.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: "One More Thing" -- Jesse.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Happy birthday to the king. It's not my birthday. Elvis Presley -- sorry, Greg.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Big fan?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Was born on 19 -- 1935. He would have been 84 today. Nominated for 14 Grammys, won three. I think he had 18 No. 1 hits in the U.S. in about a 13-year period. Amazing concert performer. Gave over 1,100 different concerts.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: You sound like a real fan, Jesse.

utterances.speaker: COMPAGNO
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Boy, the passion.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: I'm such a fan. Look at this picture right here, Greg. Right there.

utterances.speaker: GRAPHIC
utterances.sentences: PHOTOSHOPPED PHOTO SHOWING ELVIS IN HIS WHITE JUMPSUIT WITH JESSE'S FACE

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: I knew it was going somewhere.

utterances.speaker: COMPAGNO
utterances.sentences: I'm really struck by the -- hair similarity.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: I know what I'm getting him for Christmas next year. Forget the Michael Jackson jacket.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: OK, the king lives on.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: All right.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Juan.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Well, Thursday marks the 20th anniversary of a show I know you watch. Take a look at this.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Yes, "The Sopranos" hit the airways in January of '99 and, in six seasons, changed American television. Appointment TV can be credited with the rise of today's binge watching. "The Sopranos" inspired an era of shows with more ambitious plot lines and, of course, deeply-flawed characters like Tony Soprano, and it paved the way for provocative shows like "The Wire," "Breaking Bad," "Mad Men." So a tip of the hat to David Chase, who created the show and to the lead actor, James Gandolfini, who made a violent mobster into an American icon.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: All right. Dana.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: OK, well, you know Jasper is America's dog. He's very smart but not always smart. And last night, Peter showed me this video from the park, where he was kind of, like, doing what the Democrats and Republicans are doing with the shutdown. He's giving it his best shot with that stick. But he just --

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: -- he cannot get it to work. He just can't, like, run it right. Bang.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: He will not make America's -- he's not "Animals are Great." This is not "Animals are Great" material.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: It's like, come on, Jasper, one more time, try it. Oh, denied. Denied. I'll be on Tucker tonight, and we'll be previewing the president's speech at 9 p.m.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: That's funny.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Fun, fun, fun. All right. It is time for, Dana -- GUTFELD (singing): Animals are great! Animals are great! Animals are great!

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Jasper has his long stick, but these little critters, they've got the bush. Check it out. There they are, little baby. These little kittens hiding in bushes.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Isn't that great? They're like little -- they're like little, what do you call them? Those things that come up? Whack-a-moles.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Whack-a-moles?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Except they're like cats.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Whack-a-cat?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes, but I wouldn't -- I don't -- do not condone whacking cats. I think that you should never whack a cat, because you never know who that cat belongs to and they could come and whack you. But I love kittens, because they're so surprising, which is why -- GUTFELD (singing): Animals are great! Animals are great! Animals are great!

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: They are. Emily.

utterances.speaker: COMPAGNO
utterances.sentences: All right, one thing is for sure. You do not mess with UFC fighters. And I just love this story. So UFC fighter Polyana Viana was waiting for a taxi outside her Rio De Janeiro apartment when she was approached by a man who was trying to rob her and threatened that he would pull out a gun. She beat him up.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Whoa.

utterances.speaker: COMPAGNO
utterances.sentences: She's won 10 out of her 12 professional fights. She quickly took action, and she just absolutely, as you see there, just decimated this guy. And of course, she did not suffer any injuries. And the supposed gun, it turns out, was actually a cardboard cutout, so it was all for nothing. But it reminded me of that story, because remember where that gun shop was like -- there was an attempted hold-up, and the perpetrator was immediately subdued by, like, 30 people with guns. So I loved it.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: That's what I love about -- I love about women and self-defense. Because that adds a whole new, like, sense of, like --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: You like that, Greg?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: No, because guys got -- now they've got to think twice when they're mugging.

utterances.speaker: COMPAGNO
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Yes, even though they had a gun.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: The story the other day of a guy -- a woman ran into a karate studio --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: -- and the karate guy beat up the criminal.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Exactly. All right. We've got to move on. "Special Report" is up next. Hey, Bret. Content and Programming Copyright 2019 Fox News Network, LLC. ALL RIGHTS RESERVED.
